about_the_game:
DISCLAIMER: this game is still in early alpha development. Screenshots shown are not reflective of the full game.

Story

You play as Blip, a runt-of-the-litter black hole that just wants to be taken seriously. One night during a party with the other celestial bodies your best friend, a star named Shimmy, get kidnapped while you're distracted. It's now up to you to navigate the cosmos in order to get your friend back and prove just how supermassive you can really be!

Gameplay

Inspired by classic retro platformers of the past, Blip's Supermassive Adventure will see you navigating several hub worlds, each one open for exploration where certain power ups will be required to access certain areas.

Use your "event horizon" ability to pull enemies towards you, and once they're spinning endlessly near your singularity, absorb them to change your shape and use their abilities!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: glibc 2.17+, 32/64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 M380
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.0+ (2.1 with ARB extensions acceptable)
  • Storage: 1400 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Lion 10.7.5, 32/64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 M380 or Apple M1
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.0+ (2.1 with ARB extensions acceptable)
  • Storage: 1400 MB available space

short_description: Play as a tiny black hole named Blip and adventure out into the cosmos, absorbing your enemies' powers and exploring several space-themed levels in order to save your best friend, a star named Shimmy! All the while proving just how supermassive you can really be!
